quiz.title: Inequality Number Line Graphing
quiz.subtitle: Unit 6 Quiz 1: Graphing Inequalities on Number Lines
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Representing Inequalities Graphically on Number Lines

questions.question: Which number line shows $x > 3$?
options: Open circle at 3, shaded to the right
Closed circle at 3, shaded to the right
Open circle at 3, shaded to the left
Closed circle at 3, shaded to the left
questions.explanation: $x > 3$ means all numbers greater than 3. Use open circle at 3 (not included) and shade right (greater).

questions.question: Which graph represents $x ≤ -2$?
options: Closed circle at -2, shaded to the left
Open circle at -2, shaded to the left
Closed circle at -2, shaded to the right
Open circle at -2, shaded to the right
questions.explanation: $x ≤ -2$ includes -2 (closed circle) and all numbers less than -2 (shade left).

questions.question: Choose the correct graph for $-1 < x ≤ 4$.
options: Open circle at -1, closed circle at 4, shaded between
Closed circle at -1, open circle at 4, shaded between
Open circle at -1, open circle at 4, shaded between
Closed circle at -1, closed circle at 4, shaded between
questions.explanation: $-1 < x$ means open at -1 (not included). $x ≤ 4$ means closed at 4 (included). Shade between them.

questions.question: Which number line shows $x ≥ 0$?
options: Closed circle at 0, shaded to the right
Open circle at 0, shaded to the right
Closed circle at 0, shaded to the left
Open circle at 0, shaded to the left
questions.explanation: $x ≥ 0$ includes 0 (closed circle) and all numbers greater than 0 (shade right).

questions.question: Select the graph for $x < -5$.
options: Open circle at -5, shaded to the left
Closed circle at -5, shaded to the left
Open circle at -5, shaded to the right
Closed circle at -5, shaded to the right
questions.explanation: $x < -5$ excludes -5 (open circle) and includes all numbers less than -5 (shade left).

questions.question: Which represents $2 ≤ x < 7$?
options: Closed at 2, open at 7, shaded between
Open at 2, closed at 7, shaded between
Closed at both, shaded between
Open at both, shaded between
questions.explanation: $2 ≤ x$ includes 2 (closed). $x < 7$ excludes 7 (open). Shade between them.

questions.question: Choose graph for $x ≠ 3$.
options: Open circle at 3, shaded both directions
Closed circle at 3, shaded both directions
Open circle at 3, no shading
Two closed circles at 3
questions.explanation: $x ≠ 3$ excludes only 3 (open circle). All other numbers are included (shade both directions).

questions.question: Which shows $x > -2$ AND $x < 3$?
options: Open at -2 and 3, shaded between
Closed at -2 and 3, shaded between
Open at -2, closed at 3, shaded between
Closed at -2, open at 3, shaded between
questions.explanation: $x > -2$ (open at -2) AND $x < 3$ (open at 3). Compound inequality: $-2 < x < 3$.

questions.question: Select graph for $x ≤ 1$ OR $x ≥ 5$.
options: Closed at 1 (shade left), closed at 5 (shade right)
Open at 1 (shade left), open at 5 (shade right)
Closed at 1 and 5, shaded between
Open at 1 and 5, shaded between
questions.explanation: OR means union: $x ≤ 1$ (closed at 1, shade left) combined with $x ≥ 5$ (closed at 5, shade right).

questions.question: Which number line matches the inequality shown?
questions.explanation: Graph shows closed circle at -3 and shading to the right, representing $x ≥ -3$.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You master inequality graphing: open/closed circles, shading directions, and compound inequalities.
scoreMessages.70: Strong skills! Focus on distinguishing > vs ≥ (open vs closed) and AND (between) vs OR (separate regions).
scoreMessages.50: Good progress. Practice: 1) Open circle for < or >, closed for ≤ or ≥, 2) Shade left for less than, right for greater than, 3) Reading compound graphs.
scoreMessages.0: Start with basics: > or ≥ means shade right, < or ≤ means shade left. Open circle excludes point, closed circle includes point.
